page.title: 14Recreation in Rogate
page.content: Several sports are played in the village, cricket, bowls,football and a peculiarly Sussex game called stoolball. This is a kind of cross between cricket and rounders with a wicket like square, on a stand at head height. A league does exist but it seems to be confined to this patch of Sussex. A tennis club has been formed recently. The courts having been paid for by the valiant efforts of a band of people who had coffee mornings, jumble sales and play preformances to raise the money. Football is still the favourite sport for boys and netball for girls while they are in school. Swimming is the next favourite.
